TextÔøºü•π we need so much more of this in our world. So much love of God and family and community. I love everything you share. Inspires my soul. It moves me away from commercial observations of holidays and into more reverent and meaningful observation. I crave this kind of family connection and participation and unity and community. Christianity at least in the western world is like the rest of the country very individualistic. It doesn‚Äôt feel like we are a people united in any kind of belief and definitely not united in any kind of tradition that spans across millennia. You have such a rich heritage, my sister. You are such a treasure to share it with all of us. Please give your dad a big hug for me and thank him for his influence in my life. I treasure all of you. Love you so much! (totally not crying while I write this)

TextOr judge. That‚Äôs the craziest part of it all. People love to pick the part that sounds the best to them. Like the scripture that says children should honor their parents. But right after that it says ‚Äú provoke, not thy children unto wrath but bring them up in the NURTURE and admonition of the Lord. There‚Äôs another one where Jesus gives the two great commandments. Love the Lord, thy God with all thy heart might mind and strength, and the second is like into it. Love thy neighbor as thyself. (which then changes to Love One Another, even as I have loved you) On these two laws, hang ALL the laws and ALL the prophets. That means if you‚Äôre hating your neighbors because they sin differently than you do, you are breaking one of the two great commandments‚Ä¶ and that is worse than breaking any of the others. Love, not judgment. It‚Äôs hard. Most of us have a lot of unlearning to do to get there. But it sure feels a LOT better to find the good in people instead of look for things to hate.
Nov 18, 2024 9:28:38 am

Love the Lord, that God with all the heart might mind and strength, and the second is like into it. Love thy neighbor as they self. (which then changes to Love One Another, even as I have loved you) On these two laws, hang ALL the laws and ALL the prophets. That means if you‚Äôre hating your neighbors because they sin differently than you do, you are breaking one of the two great commandments‚Ä¶ and that is worse than breaking any of the others. Love, not judgment. It‚Äôs hard. Most of us have a lot of unlearning to do to get there. But it sure feels a LOT better to find the good in people instead of look for things to hate.

TextI‚Äôve only ever seen the show when I looked at that ‚Ä¶ organization. I know there is a level of good and teaching done but I saw the strings even in ads. The orchestration. The hero worship. It is a machine built to feed the machine. I would like to think the goal was to train cogs to become their own machines, powerful and autonomous.. But even if that was desired, the engineering is not conducive to that result. No one can replicate that kind of energy on their own, and the energy seems to be addictive and what draws most people in, and why most would feel too much pain from the lack of dopamine to continue alone. And if they can‚Äôt afford it? And they can‚Äôt replace that drug? Ôøº But maybe those were two powerful signals you were able to use to locate @[734554049:2048:Lea]. Somewhere in the middle. Not this. Not that. Then what? Something different. Something magical. A leader. A teacher. Powerful. Magnetic. Structured even. But not those. I have learned and now teach that sometimes the easiest way to figure out what is is to figure out what is not‚Ä¶ which often comes by experience. The more we experience what we don‚Äôt want, the clearer we become on what we do. For most of us, that can take decades. And truthfully, only a few will ever pay the price for that knowing. But the more who are willing to do it, the more there are to teach it. And there you are. ‚ô•Ô∏è
Oct 14, 2024 5:02:37 pm

TextWhat is this movie? It makes me think about the institutional training that we have in a way that I don‚Äôt really hear people talk about. It isn‚Äôt just that that school trains us that we are to show up where and when told do what we‚Äôre told within specific parameters that we are told in order to get a job where the same will happen ad Infinitum ‚Ä¶ But the glory - the prize of that effort is a home and a car and all the things to decorate both - again, ad infinitum‚Ä¶ The issue‚Ä¶ the reason the prison guards become inmates and don‚Äôt leave the prison they built is attachment. Everything is designed to create and increase attachment to first, outcomes (succeed in school, succeed at work) so that you can be attached to the fruit of the success (house, car, stuff) Attachment is powerful. Think about how many abused women never leave their abusers and why? Fear of course plays a part but attachment is why they don‚Äôt leave before it‚Äôs escalated to the point of no return. If you can create attachment in a person you can control them if you have power over the thing that they are attached to because emotions rather than logic will drive them. A practice of learning to be detached from things and outcomes becomes incredibly powerful. (The danger is if one has Zero attachments they do have love and that then puts them in danger of becoming the the cold, calculating ones who would manipulate others) If we become more attached, then, to qualities and values rather than things and specific outcomes, for example if we focus (attach) to wisdom and being one who learns, love and being one who loves, patience, integrity, loyalty etc‚Ä¶ Then we are attached to things that cannot be given or taken away. They are not tangible. They reside within us. A person like that is very difficult to control.
Aug 16, 2024 11:17:47 pm

TextShouldn‚Äôt be mind blowing. The majority never have more service than lip to invest. Everyone can invest in talking. Most do. But if they were really ready to invest in change welfare programs would be cut by 80% or more. Divorce rates would also. People want change as long as they can have it while sitting down eating popcorn with their pants unbuttoned. It isn‚Äôt about knowing what‚Äôs right. It‚Äôs about choosing what‚Äôs right at all costs for the sake of right. And very few will ever pay that price. Nothing changed since the beginning of time. Greatness could not exist unless it‚Äôs opposite did. There would be no way to define it if all was the same. Cold only means something because there‚Äôs warmth to contrast it to. You can‚Äôt make today great unless there‚Äôs another option. You can‚Äôt be great unless there‚Äôs another option. There are some who cannot help but be great. There are some who cannot possibly be great. And there are those in the middle who can be taught and persuaded towards greatness. To be taught to arm themselves against apathy and mediocrity because those things are what allow them to be pacified so they take no action. Show them the pacifiers. Then ask them who pacifiers are for. Then ask them if that‚Äôs who they are. Identity is what needs to be defined first. Once they choose an identity intentionally and the values that go with it, they will have to choose a side. They won‚Äôt be able to not see it any other way from that point forward.
Jun 27, 2024 2:07:01 pm

TextI was with you till the last line. Add in sunshine and power music and all the healthy oxytocin boosters. Energy sandwiches. Start with the good, do the hard/stressful, finish with the good. Simple system for momentum and traction even on the worst days, and even if it‚Äôs just a little forward movement. If you‚Äôre not moving forward, you risk backsliding, and it‚Äôs so much harder to recover from that than it is to make progress from slow movement.

TextWhen I was 19 I was working at a retail store called Meier and Frank. A beautiful lady approached me and asked if I had ever been a model and said I had an exotic look ü§£ She told me she worked for Mary Kay (I was familiar with it because my mom sold it when I was younger) and asked if she could do my makeup and then take pictures of me to model it. I would‚Äôve seen that pitch a mile away today. But she was charismatic. Convinced me to buy the starter kit ‚Ä¶ but I love to make up so even if I didn‚Äôt ever sell anything I was going to just enjoy it. I did meet with her a few other times, and I liked how it felt - she was confident, and she injected confidence Into everyone else around her. She pointed out the strengths that she saw. She helped people see the beauty that she saw. She went out and looked for people that she could do this with with authentically. The same thing can be done with good Copywriting. Filters out the people you can‚Äôt serve well and speaks to the soul of those you can serve so specifically it‚Äôs like you‚Äôre right there next to them and they feel it and can‚Äôt NOT be moved. When you can actually see people, when you know them and want to see them succeed, and then put your best skill and effort into making that happen (leveraged, so as not to burn out) ‚Ä¶ Nothing less than magic happens. And they‚Äôll tell their friends.

TextWhen I was 19 I was working at a retail store called Meier and Frank. A beautiful lady approached me and asked if I had ever been a model and said I had an exotic look ü§£ She told me she worked for Mary Kay (I was familiar with it because my mom sold it when I was younger) and asked if she could do my make up and then take pictures of me to model it. I would‚Äôve seen that picture a mile away today. But she was charismatic. Convinced me to buy the starter kit but I love to make up so even if I didn‚Äôt never sell anything I was gonna just enjoy it. And they‚Äôll tell their friends.

TextI have been working 100% online since 2002 when I took maternity leave for my second of four daughters. I was working at a call center and had been for 6 years as a technical manager. We housed several tech giants like Apple, Intel, Adobe, Vizio. I worked at Apple first as a technician but was in management within 2 months at the age of 20. I was already hooked on technology since age 8 when my cousin taught me BASIC programming and showed me how to write a game on a Radioshack TRS80 with25kb hard drive lol. The call center taught me how to build networks from the ground up. I could build the servers and the crossover cables and do it in Appletalk, DOS, Sco Unix, Linux, Windows NT, Windows 3.1 and Windows 95, and a coupel of Novell versions. Then I was taught how to manage metrics and do my own hiring and staffing in order to meet those metrics. I learned client diplomacy, how to hire good people, how to manage resources, and how to track and analyze data that kept me ahead of the game and constantly getting raises and bonuses. I liked that game. All of those skills served me well when I wanted to figure out how to work from home and take care of my girls. I started out on a legacy iMac the call center was throwing out with an AOL CD I got off a PC Magazine. I dabbled for a few months in Ebay stuff, bought Don Lapre's course, SMC, MLM. You name it I tried it. But I tried it and quit it all fast. I know when something doesn't jive with me. Then I found these internet marketing people. Armand Morin and Cory Rudl, then other names that I'm friends with still here today. In less than a year I had replaced my full time income as a business assistant to a young pup (he was younger than I was by 6 years I think) named Lee Benson. I supported customers, tweaked copy, wrote affirmations for a subliminal affirmation program he had, learned graphic design, learned how to customize wordpress .php files to make custom themes, learned SEO and AB split testing and then got divorced. With four girls ages 10,8,4 and 1, I had to learn how to make more money in less time. A longer story shorter, I got very good at systems and optimization. I had time to coach soccer and take my four girls to all their activities and was always home to wake them up, cuddle them on sick days and put them to bed at night. And then I learned how to do it so well that I never had to check the bank to see if I could afford whatever we needed or wanted. All of this is relative to know that with all that I've done, I've never been as excited about possibilities as I am now. The tools for leverage are incomprehensible to myself even two years ago. What I can do for myself and for my clients who also enjoy having time to be dads and moms just BLEW UP. I've been using AI for over a year. I use it to analyze data, help me think about ways to analyze it and see patterns I'd never even consider, make psychological profiles, outlines, brainstorm, and of course images. I've cloned voices for clients (not my job, but my nerd girl playtime lol) and loved shocking them with how close the voices are (at their request btw). Oh PS... I bought a course from @[729678588:2048:Craig Perrine] a good ... I dunno... 17 years ago? I feel like it was list secrets or something. It was wayyy too long ago. And I it was either cassette tapes or cd's. I've loved watching OG's who've stayed around over the years. I live in a small redneck town and there's no one like me. Here... I have a lot of fun with very smart people who are also very weird haha. Looking forward to more smartness and weirdness and jawdropping tech in 2024. Thanks for the invite, @[729678588:2048:Craig]!
Jan 15, 2024 11:59:03 pm
TextI have been working 100% online since 2002 when I took maternity leave for my second of four daughters. I was working at a call center and had been for 6 years as a technical manager. We housed several tech giants like Apple, Intel, Adobe, Vizio. I worked at Apple first as a technician but was in management within 2 months at the age of 20. I was already hooked on technology since age 8 when my cousin taught me BASIC programming and showed me how to write a game on a Radioshack TRS80 with25kb hard drive lol. The call center taught me how to build networks from the ground up. I could build the servers and the crossover cables and do it in Appletalk, DOS, Sco Unix, Linux, Windows NT, Windows 3.1 and Windows 95. Then I was taught how to manage metrics and do my own hiring and staffing in order to meet those metrics. I learned client diplomacy, how to hire good people, how to manage resources, and how to track and analyze data that kept me ahead of the game and constantly getting raises and bonuses. TextI try to never forget. Sometimes we think we won‚Äôt forget important lessons but we can. I‚Äôve learned I have to make it a practice to remember what sacred and what matters most. Journaling helps me with that. I am not a prolific journalist but that‚Äôs a practice, that I work on too. When I feel or think some things significantly I usually am sharing it with someone I care about and so I‚Äôll just take that moment to put it in my journal, which is digital and where I‚Äôm at often. I feel like the kinetic practice of just writing things down helps us to keep those things more accessible in our minds. It‚Äôs difficult to remember how debilitating pain is when you‚Äôre not in pain all the time. There are some people I know that have never experienced debilitating, emotional or physical pain. I‚Äôve had years of both. And I‚Äôve had miraculous healing also. And I was born with the strength that is not common. Same with my mind. I didn‚Äôt give myself either one of those gifts. I can‚Äôt take credit for them. And how could I possibly expect anyone who doesn‚Äôt have those gifts to have the strength that I have? Conversely, there are people with gifts and strengths I can‚Äôt even comprehend. I should not compare myself to them, or to anyone else. I heard the saying, that comparing only leads to a feeling of inferiority or superiority, and both are divisive and do no good. I actively work to look through those lenses every day . It helps to be connected to people who have great hearts and minds, and who keep evolving themselves so that I get daily reminders like this. Keep up the good work, MK.
